div1.p: This is a detailed clinical report from Africa, which describes a case of yellow fever in which the patient recovered.

div1.head: Report: Yellow Fever, November 15, 1922
div1.p:
NAME - Wilson DATE OF ADMISSION - 15/11/22
SEX - Male - Age 24 years DATE OF DISCHARGE - 4/12/22
NATIONALITY - Sabongida DIAGNOSIS - Yellow Fever.
OCCUPATION - Police Constable RESULT Cured.
- Register No: 108.

HISTORY. Patient is a Police Constable stationed at Warri, he has been only 5 months
in Warri having been transferred from Ifon in July last. He was doing night
duty in the area in which the previous Yellow Fever - an Italian - had occurred,
he had been on duty in this area from the 1st to 8th November. On the 14th
he did not feel very fit and had an attack of fever with rigors at 8 P.M. He
reported sick and was seen by me at the Out-patients on the morning of the 15th
when he informed me that he had “Yellow Fever”, and felt very ill. He was ad-
mitted into the Native Hospital at 9 A.M.

15/11/22 ON EXAMINATION - Patient appeared ill, complained of headache and general malaise.
Bowels were constipated, Nausea present with some epigastric tenderness on pres-
sure. Temp: 100 P.55 Low Tension. Sclerae slight jaundice. Tongue foul on dor-
sum with clean, red tip and edges. Mind perfectly clear. Slight tenderness over
Spleen and Liver.

URINE passed freely - Pale Yellow colour, acid reaction, albumin present. Sp.
Gr: 1010.

BLOOD EXAMINATION - No malaria parasites. Leucopenia present. Patient was
given Calomel grs. IV at 10 A.M. followed by a saline aperient at 2 P.M. Fluid
diet - barley water or Plain water. Temp: at 6 P.M. 99.2 P. 60

16/11/22 Patient had a restless night, did not sleep, complained of nausea, general aches
and pains. Bowels not opened at all, epigastrium decidedly tender. Temperature
98.4, P. 66. Passed 10 ozs: urine similar to last specimen, albumin present.
-2-
Turpentine Enema given resulting in black scybalous masses being passed.
Sclerae showing jaundice. Temp: at 6 P.M. 99.6., P. 60.

17/11/22 Patient had a fair night, slept at intervals. Temp: 99. P.54. Bowels
opened in the morning. Black tarry motion.

EXAMINATION - Pale yellow colour, cloudy, 1018. Sp. Gr. Albumin present.
Microscopic Examination after centrifuging showed numerous bile stained
granular and hyaline casts, very distinctive.

At 1 P.M. vomiting commenced, 6 ozs. of bloody gelatinous material brought
up. At 1:30 P.M. vomited again, typical black vomit - 8 ozs. Pulse 60. low
tension. Temp: 99 at 2 P.M. At 6 P.M. vomiting again occurred, Black vomit
with black debris on standing. Temp: 100, P. 60. Patient was also seen by
Dr. Young who had arrived from Lagos to investigate.

18/11/22 6 A.M. Temp: 100., P. 60. At 10 A.M. Bowels moved twice, black tarry stools.
At 2 P.M. Black vomit occurred again - 8 ozs. Temp: began to rise and at 6 P.M.
was 102.6, P 50. Passed 8 ozs Urine. Exam - acid. Sp. Gr: 1015. Albumin
present. Patient restless, epigastric pain complained of. Odour off patient
very marked and distinctive - gum washing. At 7:30 P.M. 20 c.c. of Noguchi's
Yellow Fever Serum given intravenously. At 10 P.M. patient began to perspire
freely, Temp: dropped to 101.6., p. 75. Patient fell asleep and slept till

19/11/22 12 M Temp: 99.8., p. 100 Fell asleep after nourishment and slept till 6 A.M.
temp 99.8, p. 80. Looks better and says he feels better. Passed 18 ozs. urine
through the night - Acid reaction Sp. gr: 1018, slightly albuminous. Microscopic
Examination showed bile-stained hyaline and granular casts. Bowels opened once-
Black tarry stool. No nausea, no vomiting. Took and retained all nourishments.
Temp: at 2 P.M., 100.2, P 100. At 6 P.M. 100.4. P.108., and at 10 P.M. Temp:
99.6, P. 118. Sclerae pale yellow.

20/11/22 Patient had a good night, slept well, Temp: at 6 A.M. 99.2 P. 100. At 10 A.M.
99.6, P. 102. Good tension. Took his nourishment well. No vomiting. Bowels
-3-
not moved since yesterday morning. Temp: at 6 P.M. 99. Total urine passed
in 24 hours 57 1/2 ozs. Examination - Acid. Sp:. Gr: 1015.
No albumin. Sclerae not so jaundiced. Tongue clean. Pulse good.

21/11/22 Patient had a good night, slept well. Bowels opened by calomel given previous
night. Motions yellow. No vomiting. Feels very hungry. Urine passed freely
- Acid Sp. Grv: 1020. No albumin. Jaundice clearing up. Temp: 99., p. 88.

22/11/22 Patient doing well. Slept well. No vomiting or nausea. No epigastic pain.
Bowels well opened, normal yellow stool. Urine clear, no albumin. Bile present.
Temp: 98.4, Pulse good tension 80 mt: Patient given half diet as he complained
of great hunger. Jaundice clearing.

Patient continued to do well, Jaundice disappeared on the 25th appetite became
normal and patient was discharged on the 4th of December 1922.
